website_summaries.verdict: Comfortable, adjustable knee scooter that’s ideal for anyone dealing with foot and ankle breaks, sprains, ulcers, surgery recovery, and amputation.
pros: Two-piece knee cushion provides greater comfort than many competitors
Cushion can also be adjusted to suit the height of the user
Deluxe dual braking system maximizes safety
Sturdy steel frame is extremely durable
cons: Turning radius isn’t very tight so it can be difficult to maneuver in tight spaces

customer_reviews.title: Scooter is Okay, but Customer Service is not!
customer_reviews.text: My son broke his foot, and the scooter made it much easier to get around at home, out and about, and especially at school. Problem is a part broke off, and I sent an email on their sight filling it out per their instructions what was wrong, and describing the part, and to-date I haven't heard back from anyone, so the scooter ended up being useless. If you don't back your products, you won't be in business very long.
customer_reviews.author: mgpayne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Got this scooter when I hurt my knee and could no walk. It is very easy to operate. It adjusts up and down easily. It folds down with a flip of the handle to fit into the car. The only thing that I see wrong with it is not easy in the grass or other areas that aren't solid floors or concrete. It says all terrain but that is not the case. It is very light weighs. Has great breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Potentially defective brakes!
customer_reviews.text: When the brake is fully engaged, only the very end of the pad touches the wheel (see picture). It wouldn't stop when I was going downhill! Did I get a defective unit or the design of this thing is completely flawed? There was a similar review posted in February. I will update my review when I get a proper explanation from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy, don't rent!
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Durable product. Easy to maneuver and utilize during post-ankle surgery. My shoulders and hands just are not up to using crutches. This was the perfect solution. Purchasing is about same price as 6-8 week rental from medical device company.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous: do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this product from Amazon. It arrived to me missing the crucial Tiller knob bolt for adjusting the steering column. If there is an instruction book,it came without. The mechanism for releasing steering column for folding: faulty. Brake lock doesn’t work. I suspect Amazon or company sent me a rejected lemon. Clearly what I was sent was a returned device. It was not in the manufacturer's box. I got a second device, and it is ok, except for a too large turning radius.
customer_reviews.author: DeJordy

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality product
customer_reviews.text: This walker is just ok. You are getting rather cheaply made one for the price comparable with walkers from other companies. This one was purchased to replace returned defective one made by the different company. Unfortunately, it had the same problem with the rear wheel. It did not touched the ground fully. It is definitely a bad idea to use it as is outside. In addition, the rest pad is missaligned. It also came with misaligned front wheel that i fixed. Only the steering column can be collapsed. So, you cannot put in the small car easily. We anyhow desided to keep this walker since based on our experience other ones most likely be the same
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as other more expensive options
customer_reviews.text: This is my second knee scooter experience and I do not like this scooter. First, two pads is not better than one. Get one pad. Second, you want the version that has a fixed front axle and wheels that turn based on a steering rod similar to car wheels ($159 on amazon). This version here with the axle and wheels that turn together is very unsteady on sidewalks or any bumps. Brake seems to work very well on this model. I gave it three stars but will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: thomas e dolan

customer_reviews.title: Wide turning radius limits usefulness
customer_reviews.text: The knee scooter is easier to get around with than crutches, especially with a basket to carry things. I find the knee cushion uncomfortable and can’t find the position where the edges don’t cut into my knee. It would be much more useful if it had a narrower turning radius. Just turning into a room requires either a series of forward/reverse moves like parallel parking or lifting and rotating it. It’s not heavy so I can do that but it’s frustrating. Also rolling from a hard surface to a rug or floor mat causes the handle bar to jerk. It doesn’t feel or maneuver like a bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: xandre

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay, Not Great
customer_reviews.text: This is working for me, but I would not buy it again, simply because the stability is awful! I also have to keep readjusting the breaks. Every stick, rock, or bump is felt harshly, and has nearly thrown me off more than once. The wheel base is too narrow and the tires are too small for any comfort or to maneuver in less than perfectly clear and flat paths. It was cheap, and it works, but in hindsight I would have spent more money on a better scooter since I will be using it for quite awhile. I suppose in a very temporary situation it would suffice, and the price was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Really great looking and well built
customer_reviews.text: Does not feel flimsy at all. Was hoping it would last at least 2 months until my wife recovers. It's cheaper than renting @ $80 month, and we could just chuck it in the garbage when we were done with it. But to my amazement it is quite sturdy, good looking and very easy to assemble (even without instructions). Definitely worth it, and we can just donate it when we're finished with it.
customer_reviews.author: T2i Owner

customer_reviews.title: Does the intended job but could be safer.
customer_reviews.text: Much like other reviews, this unit operates fairly well. Easy to put together and mismantle when storing away. Only downsides;”: 1. I wish it came with a brake so I wouldn’t have to hold it down to stand still. As soon as I hop off it starts rolling away. Annoying and not safe. I’ve been getting around it by wrapping a rubber band. 2. Does NOT do well on cracks. Any slight Crack is anpotential hazard and I’ve become paranoid while operating it outdoors. I’m already nursing my foot after surgery, don’t need the added tension of hurting myself further. Need to be super careful so you don’t end up hurting yourself.
customer_reviews.author: sahar nawab

customer_reviews.title: Faulty & Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product before undergoing foot surgery and unfortunately, it has failed me from delivery on. If I had more time to send it back, I certainly would have but I needed something fast. Firstly, it arrived with a huge gash in the manufacturer’s box meaning it was shipped from the facility this way. The handle bar screw cap broke into pieces immediately after removing the plastic. Secondly, the brake line was faulty which is extremely dangerous. My boyfriend ended up having to cut it because it wouldn’t roll anywhere and I couldn’t get around. Save yourself the trouble and purchase a different brand–even if it means spending a couple extra bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: meh... I guess it works.
customer_reviews.text: So it was easy to assemble, but it really doesn’t fold down much. Only folds back about 6”, not very helpful. Then it’s a pain to properly tighten and secure which sucks if your alone. Be very careful around ANY debris on the ground or cracks on the sidewalk. It’s like riding a skateboard and hitting a rock.... the scooter stops and you keep moving. And go slow, if you pick up any kind of momentum it’s unstable and wobbles, this is especially important on ADA accessible ramps. If cost is an issue then this ok. I shouldn’t have been a cheap bastard and opted for a higher end model. Oh well, live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: ItsMe

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product!
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar Drive Knee Scooter 5 years ago and this is nowhere as good as that one was. The directions for putting it together are aweful. The steering column wobbles no matter how I tighten it. The scooter still moves when the brakes are locked and I cannot for the life of me figure put how to fold it so my friends have tp take me out in my car with the back seats down because it won't fit in their cars. My old one fit easily in anyone's back seat with the steering column folded down. I would NEVER buy this scooter again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Sievert

customer_reviews.title: Have to return
customer_reviews.text: My adult daughter broke her ankle and another bone going up the outside of her leg. I bought her a walker and gave her the family wheel chair to use. She had crutches. Doctor mentioned this knee walker so I bought this also. Well, she is still unable to bend that leg and she is fearful of it so there it sits in her living room untouched. I told her it is going back as this is too expensive to store in the attic and brand new at that. I think I should of seen how she was doing weeks after the accident instead of buying it so soon after her fall. It seems to be made well, though.
customer_reviews.author: MariCarrie

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't use this thing, I had to return it. It hurt my broken ankle. It caused my cast to dig into my thigh. I felt unsafe on it. The turning radius was ridiculous, to turn around in my kitchen I had to make a 10 point turn. I am having a much easier time using my rollator walker as a modified wheel chair. I sit on it and push myself backwards to get around my house.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Drive knee scooter
customer_reviews.text: This Drive knee scooter was okay. I like the basket that came with it. But I did not like the design or functionality of the scooter seat. Because it was split in two parts it was difficult for me to properly position my knee on it comfortably. The brakes work really well. I almost threw myself when I applied the breaks. Yikes! I am somewhat clumsy, so I wasn’t great at maneuvering the scooter. Some of my issues could be operator error and not the product. Good luck, if you decide to give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Prepare for Dumb Jokes About Racing While Using This
customer_reviews.text: Absolute life saver after my car accident and ankle surgery. There is absolutely no way I could have done crutches for 12 weeks. Very stable, not too heavy that it can’t be carried up and down stairs by another person. Takes some getting used to, but if you’re getting a cast, make sure your cast maker puts extra padding on the shin so the fiberglass doesn’t hurt as you transfer your weight to your knee area. Also, take your basket off if you’re putting it in the back of the truck - it will fly out otherwise! Good luck, and just know you can get through this!
customer_reviews.author: E. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Best scooter for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be pretty heavy duty with the exception of the tires. Seat is a little long for someone my size 5' so with a cast I have to reach forward a smidge more than is comfortable but for an average size person this wouldn't be an issue. The seat is very well padded. It was easy to set up as well. Rated for 350lbs as a lightweight this thing fairly well flies...got going almost too fast off the carpet. The only improvement I would suggest would be to have some sort of way to lock the brake. I added a loop of electrical tape that I can flip over the handle to keep the brake in the engaged position.
customer_reviews.author: phoenixx

customer_reviews.title: Locking mechanism not working at first
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't get the locking button to engage at first. Only after really pushing in the brake lever hard did it finally allow us to pop in and lock the brake. The unit itself is made nicely for the money and glides well. Not a great turning radius because wheels are so close together, but you get what you pay for. Basket is nice and easily removed and handlebar height is very easy to adjust up or down. Overall happy with purchase and it sure beats crutches!
customer_reviews.author: Ohio snowbird

customer_reviews.title: 796. Great alternative to crutches
customer_reviews.text: I had hammertoe surgery and though I was weight bearing immediately in a boot, my mobility was limited for at least 4 weeks. I purchased the 796. Easy to use, easy to assemble. You can use it outside on pavement though be careful of bumps and cracks. It works best inside, allowing you to do light errands in a store. Know that this is not an all terrain type of scooter but for the money, it works very well. The attached basket is handy and the cushion on the pad is good, so purchasing a cover is not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: NHToTXAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Too Tall...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who had to have ankle surgery. Unfortunately, at 5'3, this was TOO TALL for her to use, even at the lowest setting, which is one reason for the 3 stars. Also, this has a VERY TIGHT, DIFFICULT TO MANEUVER TURN RADIUS, so be prepared to do lots of "3 point turns". On a positive note, it was VERY easy to assemble (I did it myself in about 15 minutes). Also, it was much cheaper than renting one, had it worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Catie

customer_reviews.title: A huge relief from the pain of crutches if you have chest injury.
customer_reviews.text: This wheelie is a godsend. Truly. My husband was in an accident. Fractured one foot. And bruising across chest from the seatbelt, meant extreme pain using crutches. This helped him get around the house by himself and made going to all the doctors appointments much easier and less painful. And now he’s back at work and despite a few jokes from his colleagues this helps a great deal. The ‘tactical supply receptical’ as he calls it ‘it’s not a basket’ ;) helps to carry his paperwork among other things. 4 out 5 only because of the turning radius. To maneuver tight turns and corners you must lift and scoot, lift and scoot.
customer_reviews.author: V. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable
customer_reviews.text: This scooter is probably a good representation of the product, but at 67 years old I don’t think it’s stable or maneuverable enough for me. I think if you aren’t pretty stable you’re better off with a walker or wheelchair. It’s fine on a nice flat surface but is very wonky over raised thresholds. It’s harder in the bathroom than the walker...you can move a light walker around but this is much heavier to nudge into position. Not a good solution for my level of fitness/balance.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a 5 star review
customer_reviews.text: Product looks great. Only 1 issue. The screw/knob that keeps the handlebars in place was not in the package. Our alternative was to disassemble the product, re-bag it and return it. PITA. Also, we ordered it because it is the only way for my mom to get out of the house (she cannot put her foot on the ground due to a recent surgery.) Waited 3 days for it, and now have to wait even longer because this piece is missing. SUPER FRUSTRATING!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Poor balance and brakes
customer_reviews.text: Think it tips to easy. The break works well when you go to stop it. However when wanting to lock it in for stationary purposes is nearly impossible to lock it. I can’t do it at all and my husband has to press on it extremely hard. To release is the same way. I am unable to do it. I always have to call for him to lock it or unlock it. Would never buy it again or recommend to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not super easy to fold but overall okay
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to assembly as most parts is already put together. The folding is a bit tricky as you have to release and let loss the screw. Once I was taking a Uber and driver had a hard time folding it for me... Stability is okay as long as the folding part is tightened. It's not super smooth while riding given its small wheel. Steering is not as wide as you want it to get, so for small space you might need to turn, backup, turn again. I travelled it with United airline to FL and had no problem checking it in at the gate at not charge.
customer_reviews.author: Wei

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t live without it!
customer_reviews.text: This lasted through my 5 months of recovery after foot reconstruction AND my football lineman son’s high ankle surgery recovery of 2 months. I will admit my son killed it, but he was rough on it and this was after I had it and didn’t treat it like it was made of glass. You will have to buy a pad for your knee if you need to be in this longer than a couple of weeks. If any of us need to be on crutches again, I will buy this scooter instead without a second thought!
customer_reviews.author: Maestro/a

customer_reviews.title: This is a game changer
customer_reviews.text: Having this scooter is truly a game-changer for someone like me who is recovering from Achilles heel surgery. It gives you the ability to move around without putting weight on the injured foot. The basket allows you to bring something around without using your hands.I use it with a pad to make it more comfortable. I would recommend getting one instead of renting, as it will be a big help during the first month of your recovery phase, and costs as much as renting.
customer_reviews.author: Madam X

customer_reviews.title: Nice option to crutches, Arm saver
customer_reviews.text: Really handy for foot injury or surgery. Came mostly assembled. Opted for basket so my wife could put her purse in it and not juggle stuff around. Nice option to eleaviate strain on arms from crutches. Wish had a better turn radius since we have a little hallway but overall she loved it. Has a brake lock that helps when getting positioned or if your just stopped. Was a little rough if you have to ride over a bump or crack.
customer_reviews.author: A Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Best crutch replacement for the value.
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived without any packaging besides the big box. After a call to get some credit for the damaged basket. We took this through Denver's international airport. To dallas international. All the way to Narita airport in tokyo. Worked great. If I had it to do over again I would choose one with taller tires and wider stance. However even for a real big guy...this worked like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service availability
customer_reviews.text: Drive Knee Walker, Model 796 looked like a nice product except it appeared to be missing the Tiller Adjustment Knob - that's the fastener that holds the handlebar in place. Without it, the scooter is useless. No phone number for customer support, instead only email or live chat. I live chatted and found out that the missing part is on back order with no estimated in stock date. After I looked in the packaging, I found the part behind one of the box flaps. I just hope that we don't need further customer support on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Schmieder

customer_reviews.title: Good scooter for ankle surgery
customer_reviews.text: Got this small one for daughter scooting around after a broken ankle. Doesn’t tip over like the 3 wheel versions, more stable with 4 wheels. Also have the all terrain at double the price, this one way easier & more stable. It needs to fold up better, doesn’t really fold at all, you have to take handle off & awkward to get in car. Otherwise it’s good value for sure!
customer_reviews.author: pelly

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: The brake was really hard to lock for about the first 4 days or so. After that it wasn't as stiff. At first it took a Lot of hand strength to use. Having the basket to help carry things was excellent! The cost to rent a bare bones scooter with no basket was $30 less than buying this outright. The convenience was worth the little extra. This was definitely better than using crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi M. Works

customer_reviews.title: Helps me get around.
customer_reviews.text: Good well built unit. The basket was great. Didn't care much for the split padded knee rest. Would have prefered a single piece. Also this unit does not have a very good turning radius but it beats my old one that did not have any turning ability. I took it to Disney for a week of walking and chasing grandkids and it worked great except where they had cobblestone walks it was a little difficult with the small size wheels. But on parking lots and normal sidewalks it was great.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoMaker

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy duty and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy duty and gets the job done. This is one of those items you may not need often but pays for itself the first time you use it. I had heel spur and Morten's neuroma on one foot 2 months ago and the other foot 2 days ago. I literally couldn't move around without one. It's a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Meza

customer_reviews.title: Feels solid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who broke his ankle just recently. Feels very solid when tighten up correctly which could be a problem sometimes for inpatient teenager. Turn circle could be a little smaller but other than that performs well. Is equipped with good brake as well as parking brake mechanism which is very simple to use yet reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Simon - Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Steering mechanism was loose and difficult to turn. Need a wide radius for turns and did not work well on carpet. Knee pad was extremely uncomfortable and caused my lower leg to become very sore to the point where I could use the knee walker for only short periods of time. Brake was not good for coasting - had to compress hand brake hard to get walker to stop, not able to just slow down. Thank goodness I only needed it for a short period of time. Basket on the front was handy.
customer_reviews.author: Tugboat53

customer_reviews.title: Steering Guide
customer_reviews.text: This products brakes wore out within two weeks of use. I had to use it for two weeks and then I was in a boot. Afterward, I had to have surgery, so we took it out from the garage again and with two weeks of use (4 total) a piece that serves as a steering block broke off. Twice I fell from this scooter landing on my cast and straining my surgical incision. I have five more weeks to heal - my only option is to purchase a new one, which on a teacher's salary is challenging! There is no phone number provided for customer service or recourse. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Seana Mekari

customer_reviews.title: Good scooter for indoor use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this scooter ever since my foot surgery, four weeks ago. I prefer to use it inside the house on hardwood floors because it rolls smoothly . I used this scooter outside once for my followup appointment. I did not like how it rolled on concrete. It actually made me feel a if I was about to fall off of it. My second time outside of the house with it will be tomorrow. If I feel differently I'll update this review
customer_reviews.author: Meek712

customer_reviews.title: Helpful, better than crutches, but painful in long durations.r
customer_reviews.text: Designed to keep weight off ankle/foot, this is incredibly painful for my knees. Buy or make some sort of additional padding to cushion your knee. Not keen on the design and placement of knee pad, gap was a bad choice. Feel it would be better if there was a way to move the knee support closer to the handle, so my arms weren't extended all the time, adding stress to shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: AngelinaTurner

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this right after her leg surgery. It seemed great for awhile but a bearing in the front wheel as went bad now and of couse it happened a day after it was returnable. So now the Drive people are giving me the run a round about getting a new one. So i had to order a new wheel from a different company and of course delays so were still waiting for a new wheel. Wife is not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dealman

customer_reviews.title: Good with some reservation
customer_reviews.text: In many ways the walker is great. Easy to assemble, easy to use, and very handy. The biggest problem is the brake. The cable broke about two weeks after I got it. Amazon did send me another one right away, so that was great. The brake does loosen up. I am afraid to tighten it too much, in case it breaks again. It would great if it had a stronger cable. Even right now it won't always hold. I do wish it could be tightened more so it won't move.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great value
customer_reviews.text: Wrecked my ankle and still had errands to run. Then a neighbor's child did something similar a few months later. We both used this and love it. Game changer. Much lighter and easier to use than the rental ones at a local medical supply company. Also more stylish and the added basket is a godsend. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Crew Mom

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I got then when I broke my leg and ankle. I would not have survived the initial 2 months I had to be in a cast without this scooter.I could even wheel this into the bathroom with no problems and I used it to walk my dog and navigate the grocery store. I'm keeping it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to scoot around
customer_reviews.text: The padding could be a little better. Its thick but being on it for so long I did end up with some bruising. It worked perfect for what I needed. The basket was very handy to have and though the scooter is a little awkward it was not overly heavy. I was able to lift it and put it in the car only standing on one foot. Definitely worth purchasing, way better than crutches!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Varela

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to do!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had shoulder surgery then went and broke my ankle. Therefore , crutches were a no go. I ordered this because I needed something to help me get around. It was the most economical and reviews were decent. It does what I need it to do. I'm cautious when using it so there's never been an issue with it toppling over. The break works well and it's sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When speeding through Target or the like, I recommend using a "manual foot brake".
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'3' and used this scooter used it to get around mostly indoors, on smooth tile or cement floors. It handles outdoors sidewalks and asphalt well. Rough concrete or conglomerate are a bit more challenging, but manageable. Turning is limited to about 45 degrees for safety. The single, rear break is adequate for speeds below 5 mph . When speeding through Target or the like , I recommend using a "manual foot brake". Easy assembly, managed it myself a day after my Achilles's tendon repair surgery. Best thing about this scooter is that it folds up and easily fit behind the driver's seat of my Nissan Versa hatchback.
customer_reviews.author: roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Rolls well, Great Breaks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this following an injury in a car wreck. I had borrowed a friends until this one came in. The breaks on this one worked much better and it rolled easier. The basket comes in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver!! With a broken foot I'm unable to put weight on my foot, and I fell twice in our house with crutches. With this handy scooter I can actually function in my home, doing most of the things I need to do. The handy basket allows me to carry things from the frig to countertop, and to keep essential things with me at all times (phone, book, etc.). It is lightweight enough to maneuver into position in tight spaces. I would not want to be without it during this recuperation.
customer_reviews.author: LifelongReader

customer_reviews.title: Extremely dangerous!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first the scooter was great. Then unbeknownst to me the steering stop had broken off due to a faulty weld. This allowed the front wheels to turn completely around with no stop. It " dumped" me very hard. I have had major foot repair surgery and am not to put any weight or pressure on my foot. There went that! In trying to catch myself I put my full weight on the surgically repaired foot. Not cool at all! Please pay attention to the "turn stop" welded on the front of the scooter! Very poorly welded on mine! This makes the scooter extremely dangerous if this breaks off as mine did.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scooter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scooter when my wife fractured her ankle. I did extensive research before purchasing this one. It is very sturdy and has a somewhat restricted turn radius which prevents accidentally tipping over. The basket allows my wife to do more activities around the house, carrying laundry, etc. It has one brake, not two, but that is not an issue(she doesn't exactly speed around the neighborhood).
customer_reviews.author: Ann Meister

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUSLY UNSTABLE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product because it was unstable and dangerous. It pitched backwards and through me down with a freshly fractured ankle. I sustained injury to my tailbone, now Amazon wants to mess with me, delay my refund and send and bill me for another scooter. I guess an injury attorney is in order. I would have given NO stars but this system will not allow me to.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie B Hill

customer_reviews.title: A Lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been EXTREMELY helpful. A lifesaver. I have been on this thing for a month now with a severe foot injury and it get's me all around the house. The brakes are great and the cushion is soft enough. My shin is a bit wore out but I can't put my foot on the ground so it is what it is. Brakes are easy to tighten as well you just loosen the little silver knob by the handle and tighten some up. The retighten the knob. I don't know what I would have done without this.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy M Kaylor

customer_reviews.title: Good value to use for ankle injury on hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: It very adjustable but my husband says the foldable part is hard for him, so I won't attempt. I am trying to learn how to use it. I'm 63 and getting ready for ankle surgery. I'm going to say putting all my weight on my knee is not comfortable. I also ordered a 2 inch foam cover. If I was more young and coordinated it wouldn't be so hard. Surgeon said to get one. This is for getting around the house not the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Honeygoes247

customer_reviews.title: Better for indoor use due to wheels
customer_reviews.text: If I could go back in time, I would buy a cart with larger, stubby wheels that can negotiate cracks in the sidewalk. The wheels on this cart get caught in fairly small sidewalk cracks. When they get caught, the front turns the direction of the crack. It is nearly impossible to control the cart when the front turns suddenly. I've fallen off half a dozen times. Other than that, it works well, is a good price, and folds up easily to fit in the trunk. It is good for indoor use or on very smooth concrete or asphalt. But since I would never buy it again, I'm giving it a 2.
customer_reviews.author: Sbeek

customer_reviews.title: Great scooter for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Broke my foot and ankle, purchased this as an easier way to get around then just using crutches. very easy to use! Very sturdy. Basket is a nice addition to be able to carry items around. The brake is very useful so you don’t have to drag your foot to stop. Goes over the front door hump with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get the turning radius equal left and right. Cannot get it close
customer_reviews.text: The front axle, when perpendicular to the frame, allows a bigger movement or turn in one direction that it does the other. In a material amount. We have taken the tiller off and used a number six hex wrench to loosen the front mechanism and tried to move it and tighten it but it still does not have equal turning radius left and right. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi Trout Bear

customer_reviews.title: SAFE and stable mobility!
customer_reviews.text: Using crutches caused me to fall 3 times AFTER my initial accident that broke my heel. The THIRD fall caused a broken wrist ... This knee walker is AWESOME ... no more falling, able to get around the house to continue my life. The basket gives me the ability to take items from point A to point B and the fact that the brake can be set allows me to keep it in one place, steady and still, while I attend to something on the counter etc. Best money I've spent in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Renee M Fransen

customer_reviews.title: Does work, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Get a the job done. Poor packaging which allows for damage to the cushion. Not as easy as they claim to fold up, we have to use a key to pop the tab in order to fold. Would recommend getting one with larger wheels as this one has very little surface area with the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Brown

customer_reviews.title: Just don’t.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely get this if you want to fall and break more bones. Turning radius is even worse than you think it will be. It goes super fast and is hard to slow down and even hard to go slow at all even on purpose. If you hit any sort of crack in the cement- and all cement has cracks- it will either be jarring, throw you from the scooter, or stop in its tracks. I can’t not recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good for around the house only.  Upgrade if you want to go outside with your scooter
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my scooter for about two weeks. If I had to do it over again, I would definitely buy wheels with treads on them. You can feel every bump with this scooter if I go outside with it. And because it’s so bumpy, the handlebars are loose too. I did end up purchasing a pad and cover to go over the new pad as well. The pad makes it much more comfortable, if you’re on it for more than five minutes you’ll need one too
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Perez

customer_reviews.title: great item, make sure you inspect the screws
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have item unless you prefer to be absolutely miserable by using crutches instead. If it doesn't fit in your trunk then it is a bit of work to put in the back seat. getting extra cushion is very much needed. the con to thus scooter is I just discovered it is missing 2 out of 4 screws that hold the cushion in. I wish I would have knownthe screws need checking.
customer_reviews.author: Dean and Robin

customer_reviews.title: Life would be hard without it
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver. It is great for indoors, however is is hard to maneuver on sidewalks and streets. The knee pad is not the most comfortable thing if your on it for more then a couple minutes, but they sell cushions for that. I couldn't get it to fold down, but it fits in my trunk anyways. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prefer crutches
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be an outlier here. I returned this and went back to crutches. Personally I don’t find crutches to be all that uncomfortable so I was mostly hoping to use this to have an extra hand and carry things. However it is completely inoperable with one hand due to its pore maneuverability. The basket is too narrow to hold many things, even a small plate. It’s also just a lot slower than crutches. While holding things with crutches causes them to swing a lot, of you can fit something in the basket it is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: sure beats crutches for long distances
customer_reviews.text: great for torn calf muscle. a little cumbersome though. turning radius not so great (safety feature). not as portable as crutches, but relieves my other leg from the entire weight of my body. if your injury is near your knee or oven thigh, it may not be as helpful as the pressure will be on your knee instead of leg/foot.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Durable and portable scooter
customer_reviews.text: This knee scooter worked wonderfully after having foot surgery and not able to walk for 8 weeks. The scooter is sturdy and the wheels are quite durable. I don't know how I would have gotten on without it, especially during the Christmas season. The scooter is portable; light enough to load in and out of my car so I was able to carry on with my daily activities like shopping and whatnot. The basket was so handy to have as well. I did splurge on an optional fuzzy pad covers for the knee pad and it made things more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: TX heat

customer_reviews.title: Turning Radius Bad
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find this knee walker to be stable. At least I never felt comfortable using it. You cannot easily turn it. I had to get off, pick it up and turn it around, then get back on. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Helen B.

customer_reviews.title: Go Slow,You can tip it over if you’re not careful.
customer_reviews.text: My wife broke her foot and I bought this for her so she could get around.The construction of the scooter is very solid,and maneuvers really good. I even did a couple of laps and is pretty quick.The pad that you put your knee on is also very comfortable. I would recommend getting the basket,because it does take two hands to steer,.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Palluck

customer_reviews.title: started out ok, but brakes broke after not even a week
customer_reviews.text: The assemble went easy enough, but I can't believe the brakes broke after not even a week! Looks like I lost a screw and now the brakes won't work at all! The brakes were not even part of the assembly! So I have to send it back, will have to try another brand or something. Also, the turn radius on this thing wasn't the best. It couldn't even handle a turn on the handicap ramp. oh well
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Helps me not feel so helpless
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier than crutches. It adds a little sense of independence while I'm not weight bearing on my broken ankle. The basket allows for carrying some items for yourself. It was extremely easy to put together and is easy to fold down for travel. My only complaint is the turning radius is less than stellar. But I've gotten very good at billion point turns.
customer_reviews.author: inoracam

customer_reviews.title: So Glad I Ordered this Drive Knee Walker
customer_reviews.text: I had to have foot surgery and cannot use crutches. I ordered this Drive Knee Walker. This has worked so well, much better than I ever thought it would. Could not have done so well with my surgery without it, because is so easy to maneuver through the house, can get to everything I need, is sturdy, lightweight and will fold up to put in vehicle . Drive gets a gold star for the quality, the price, and shipment. I received it much sooner than I expected. I would recommended this to anyone having foot surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Add straps for better mobility
customer_reviews.text: This is the model our doctor's office recommended. It is built strong, but it is heavy. It is hard to scoot the back wheels sideways to maneuver in tight places such as the bathroom or to get close to chairs. To fix that, I added straps from the back brake frame to the handlebar. These work like reins, making it easier to pull the back of the scooter sideways. They also make it easier to lift the scooter. I highly recommend this modification.
customer_reviews.author: Max Rae

customer_reviews.title: decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: the major complaint i have with this is i had to buy extra coushin for it, the one on it it hard and irritates my leg. doesnt do well on sidewalk or when going to carpent from tile floor. If you plan on using outside or somewhere other than home I would get the one with the all terain wheels
customer_reviews.author: Acon

customer_reviews.title: Tips easily
customer_reviews.text: Returned, deemed unsafe for my need. Does not transition well to rugs, turning radius sharp but then wants to tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended With Experience
customer_reviews.text: It's been a blessing having this scooter. I had cervical spine surgery not long before the ankle surgery and crutches just weren't a good option for me and would have forced me to be out of work for at least six weeks. With the scooter I was able to go back to work after a week. It helps me get around easily and provides a seat when I needed one and with the basket I don't have to rely on anyone to carry my bags. I did well on my own in and out of my husbands truck but wasn't able to mange alone in my car. All in all, the pros far out way the cons with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade version
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdier model than others. Locking brake comes in handy. If needed you can sit on it, lock the brake for safety. Basket comes in handy while making trips from the kitchen. Tires are also upgrade. Bought sherpa pad for added comfort.
customer_reviews.author: mike k.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative to crutches!
customer_reviews.text: The quality was good but not great. It rolls nice but I was disappointed that the parking brake broke on the 2nd day and it is difficult to collapse to put in the car. I gave it 4 stars because it is an excellent alternative to crutches and is sturdy. It is being used by my son who is 195lb.
customer_reviews.author: suze campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for over 200 pounds
customer_reviews.text: It has given me mobility and the basket has assisted me in many ways those are the plus side. I would not recommend for anyone over 200 pounds (I'm way below that), steering column and pad where knee goes are very wobbly and cannot be tightened. After 1 week of use where we needed to fold down steering column, pin securing it into place broke. Not recommended for getting across sidewalks and most outdoor activities until you have used it inside for a few weeks and feel secure on it, even then be prepared to go very slow. In hindsight, wish I'd paid more and gotten all terrain with bigger tires and sturdier body of scooter.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J Wolcott

customer_reviews.title: Amazing aide for those who truly need it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom so she can get around after foot surgery, so Recife is mostly from her. The scooter is lightweight, so she has no difficulty lifting it into her trunk on occasions she has to. It’s compact enough to where groceries for in the trunk with it. The comfort on her knees is a plus, as she had to use it quite a bit to run errands at any given point. It’s seriously made her time easier and it’s a relief to me knowing she’s okay.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: This little buggy was worth every penny. I was a danger to myself and others on crutches. Facing six weeks of no weight bearing after an ankle injury,this gave me the gift of freedom and mobility. I could use it in the kitchen and to get around freely without the exhausting and sometimes perilous use of crutches. No tools required to put it together, the hardest part was freeing it from the packaging. If I could give it 10 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Jan schmale

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Indoors
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are hard and work best on a hard indoor surface. Do not try to take this one off road, or on carpet too much. Adjustable seat easy to adjust, and height of handle bar was easy to adjust as well. Basket is easily removable too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Brothers

customer_reviews.title: Mine is wobbly
customer_reviews.text: It is well put together, and easily adjustable, but mine has a slight wobble when operating over smooth surfaces, as if an axle is slightly bent or something. Adjusting it does nothing to fix the wobble. Maybe I just got a bad one.
customer_reviews.author: P. D. G.

customer_reviews.title: Split seat and huge turn radius makes this not the choice for me
customer_reviews.text: The split seat on this scooter hurt my knee. Some scooters have a groove to lay your leg in if you turn the scooter sideways, to use as a rest. If you have a boot, you can rest it in the grooves on this, but with my knee unsupported it was uncomfortable. The turn radius is not workable for me. I understand this helps stability, but being on my own through this injury, I need more maneuverability. I'm exchanging this for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from amazon
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product from amazon. Had it for less than 2 months and the hand brake is broken. All the customer service person would say was you are out of your window to return. People who buy a knee scooter don't buy it for fun. Ludacris that they offer no replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley King Sayre

customer_reviews.title: Crutches are a pain Crutches are a pain and this saved  me
customer_reviews.text: I had foot surgery and used this for 3 months I loved it it saved me. Just had foot surgery again and used it for the second time. Will store it and More than likely have to use again And my cat loved it also😂
customer_reviews.author: sabine jones

customer_reviews.title: Proceed with caution....
customer_reviews.text: This product is unsteady-wobbly. The steering assembly has too much play in it at the bottom of shaft. Also, any little tiny thing, such as a tiny rock will about throw you over the handle bars, cracks or small bumps in concrete....forget about it!!!! I cannot recommend this scooter, especially to elderly or anyone with weakness or balance issues.
customer_reviews.author: ROBIN

customer_reviews.title: A  must have for foot injury recovery
customer_reviews.text: Broke my heel bone couple of weeks ago in this unit has been a real asset to be able to get around on I highly recommend it to anyone who has had foot surgery Even in small areas it is easy to maneuver The kneepads could use a little more cushion down but they function fine I ordered a additional knee pad cover for it, that helped a little
customer_reviews.author: Naildriver

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This product met my expectations. Assembly was a snap! As noted in some of the other reviews, one must be careful going over the cracks or uneven services, as the wheels are kind of small and hard. For the price, this works fine as a short term scooter. If I had to go for a longer period, I might upgrade to something that had bigger wheels, and was able to handle rough surfaced better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Big

customer_reviews.title: I like this but would not recommend this for anyone that ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this but would not recommend this for anyone that is older or with balance problems. It can get away from you if you don't have good balance which could cause even more injury. I work in home healthcare and never recommend these for older folks but younger folks with good balance can zoom around pretty good. Takes some practice backing up. Love the basket to carry stuff around with me. I was using this for a severe ankle injury were I was non weight bearing for 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this knee wheeler for emergency and when i got it the tires didnt move together. No way to contact provider. now that I've had it a month well before then the handle bars come lose i have to keep tighten it it shakes as if the wheel alignment is off. the handle bars i can move foward and backwards also i have to continue to tighten does not feel safe. There is a screw at the bottom where i have to continuously tighten it goes to the brakes. I needed this very urgent due to a broken foot and i could not do the crutches. Hope it ladts me couple more months
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: Easy to capsize.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product. The small wheels allow it to tip over easily. I have wiped out several times. When the wheel hits a tiny stone on sidewalk or even grout lines in our tiled floors just right the handlebars quickly turn. Unless you have a tight grip on the handlebars when the wheels quickly turn you will capsize and end up on the floor. I would spend more dollars and purchase a knee scooter with larger, inflatable tires.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D. Bloom

customer_reviews.title: If you are going to be on a no-load restriction ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to be on a no-load restriction for any length of time, this beats being on crutches all the time. I borrowed one to have at work. Bought this one to have at home. I use crutches to get be in between. Your knee will still get plenty tired, but on the flat, this is fast, not nearly as wearing as crutches,, the basket is handy for carrying small items. Buy it. Use it. Sell it at 50 - 75% of what you paid for it when you are done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had foot surgery and needed to get around at school. She has been using this for about 3 weeks and it works great. Worth the money. It’s holdinh up well and she can move around in it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Watch your good ankle
customer_reviews.text: My left ankle, ( the good one ), was struck several times by the rear wheel hub. Pretty painful after the 2rd time. Yes I am fairly careful but it still happened several times. As I have successfully used a knee scooter, before I think protection from this problem could be resolved by a plastic pop in hub cap. And wider wheels would make traversing those yellow bumps and uneven surfaces much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great Scooter for helping a patient to get around easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scooter at a great price. We bought ours for less that 1 months rent at the medical supply store. We were going to need it for a month or more so by buying one we saved money over the rental and we still have a Scooter we can loan to a friend. A win/win in my book
customer_reviews.author: David R. Hassall

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I ruptured my Achilles and had surgery and my husband ordered me this and I’m so happy he did. It was such an amazing help. I used it for 6 weeks and then I had an accident and re tore my Achilles and had to use it again so I’m definitely getting my money’s worth but this scooter is comfy and very easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Great for pricing but gets loose as you use more & more
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a lifesaver ! I’ve been using for over one month and a half and I would say it’s a great product easy to put together once delivered but as you use every day there is some components that get loose, Brake cable screw, And shaft of handle long as you have a tool kit around you should be fine
customer_reviews.author: Jeff from Boston, Ma

customer_reviews.title: Easily assembly took about three minutes no tools
customer_reviews.text: Similar design and same brand as what my local medical supply offered but nearly 1/3 of the price. Received today before my DR appointment and they weer impressed with the price and quality. Rated up to 350lbs. made much easier for me to get around.
customer_reviews.author: D. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Better than having to use crutches
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely better than using crutches. However I had to send in for a replacement just 2 weeks due to a wheel bearing going out in the back left wheel. Also the locking mechanism for the hand break was missing. The replacement I received is working just fine except for the breaking system. Putting the pads on the rubber of the wheel is not a good design when the wheels become wet and the tensioning screw on the hand break stripped out so the break now do not work well even when wheels are dry.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Bennett

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Dual Pad Steerable Knee Walker with Basket, Alternative to Crutches
product_meta.description: Dual Pad Steerable Knee Walker with Basket, Alternative to Crutches
feature_bullets: 8" casters are ideal for indoor/outdoor use. Ideal for individuals recovering from foot surgery, breaks, sprains, amputation, and ulcers of the foot
Knee walker can be steered for increased maneuverability. Durable, steel frame with silver vein finish; Comes with a removable front basket
Do not operate on inclines above 15 degrees slight incline. Do not travel over drops or barriers such as curbs or parking stops
Deluxe braking system for increased safety. Weight Limit is 300 pounds
Overall Dimensions: 30"(L) x 16"(W) x 31"(H); Knee Pad Dimensions: 15"(L) x 7"(W) x 16.5" 20.5"(H); Handle Height: 31" 40"

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
